intro: Lavoisiera bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored lavoisiera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its striking bi-colored leaves, typically featuring a mix of green and red or purple hues. Its small, clustered flowers are usually pink or white, adding to its ornamental appeal. Lavoisiera bicolor thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
